study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study aim to evaluate the outcome on oncological side and patient satisfaction on the aesthetic side with skin-sparing mastectomy and immediate breast reconstruction for patients with early breast cancer . The obtained results may contribute to the formulation of guidelines achieving low morbidity, high levels of patient satisfaction and oncological safety in breast cancer patients.

primary_outcome.description: the pathological report postoperative reveals safety free margins

secondary_outcome.description: follow up any malignancy recurrence post operative by MRI , Mammograghy and look for any new skin nodule appearance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 months postoperative for each case
secondary_outcome.description: number of deaths intraoperative and postoperative related to surgery
look for any postoperative ischemia appear in the skin flap as appearance of dark unhealthy tissue in the edge

arm_group.description: This study aim to evaluate the outcome on oncological side and patient satisfaction on the aesthetic side with skin-sparing mastectomy and immediate breast reconstruction for patients with early breast cancer .

intervention.description: , Skin sparing mastectomy and immediate breast reconstruction will be conducted to all women included in the study, transverse rectus abdominis musculocutaneous flap recostruction and latissimus dorsi myocutaneous pedicle-flap with and without implant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The study will include 30 women with early-stage breast cancer treated at general surgery department, Assuit University Hospitals
- For all patients an informed consent for their inclusion in the study including the use of images will be obtained.
- Selection criteria include women with a pre-operative diagnosis (clinical examination, imaging and needle biopsy) of Tis, T1 and T2 tumours without extensive skin involvement.
